abstract: As regulators press for banks to be safer, financial firms are transferring the risk of some assets to a less regulated area of Wall Street.
snippet: As regulators press for banks to be safer, financial firms are transferring the risk of some assets to a less regulated area of Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Banks have been shedding risky assets to show regulators that they are not as vulnerable as they were during the financial crisis. In some cases, however, the assets don’t actually move — the bank just shifts the risk to another institution.

headline.main: Seeking Relief, Banks Shift Risk to Murkier Corners
headline.print_headline: Seeking Relief, Banks Shift Risk to Murkier Corners
